graph

Class GraphMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.GraphMatrix

  • public class GraphMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an undirected graph G = (V,E) and the edges in the graph are stored in an adjacent graph.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphMatrix(int size)
      Returns a graph G = (V, E) consisting of n vertices and an empty set of edges, E.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GraphMatrix addEdge(int vertex0, int vertex1)
      Inserts the edge e = {vertex0, vertex1} to the graph G = (V, E).
      boolean edgeExists(int vertex0, int vertex1)
      Returns true if the edge e = {vertex0, vertex1} eixsts in the graph G = (V, E).
      int getColour(int vertex)
      Returns the colour of the given vertex.
      int getDegree(int vertex)
      Returns the degree of the given vertex, that is how many edges the vertex has.
      int getFreeColour(int vertex)
      Returns the lowest colour that can be used for colour the vertex.
      int[][] getMatrix()
      Returns the adjacent matrix which contains the edges in the graph.
      int getMaxColour()
      Returns the highest colour that has been used to colour the graph.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getNeighbours(int vertex)
      Returns the neighbours of the given vertex, that an arraylist of the vertices that are adjancent to the given vertex.
      int getSaturation(int vertex)
      Returns the saturation of the given vertex, that is number of colours in found in the neighbourhood
      int[] getVertices()
      Returns an array of the vertices in the graph.
      GraphMatrix removeEdge(int vertex0, int vertex1)
      Removes the edge e = {vertex0, vertex1} from the graph G = (V, E).
      void setColour(int vertex, int colour)
      Assigns the given colour to the given vertex.
      int size()
      Returns the size of the graph including an extra coloum/row for storing the colours given to each vertex.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Converts the graph to a string and returns it.

      • getFreeColour

        public int getFreeColour(int vertex)
        Returns the lowest colour that can be used for colour the vertex. A colour is free to use for colouring if none of the neighbours of the given vertex has been coloured by the colour.
        Parameters:
        vertex - - the given vertex
        Returns:
        the lowest colour that can be used for colour the vertex
